name: In the Bedroom
description: A New England couple's college-aged son dates an older woman who has two small children and an unwelcome ex-husband.

review.author: poetellect
review.heading: wow...pay attention for Sissy Spacek's name at this year's Oscars...
review.reviewBody: So simple. So honest. So heartbreaking. I dare you to see this movie and not go through a self-invasive, heartfelt understanding for the familial and emotional conflicts these characters go through. one of the best films shown at Sundance, hands down. Not a movie for the emotionally squeamish...brutally powerful... Violent, excruciating truth and beauty...the raw emotional power imbued into the scenes with Wilkinson and Spacek are Oscar-worthy. Marisa Tomei finally gets a role worthy of her talent since My Cousin Vinny. Utterly unforgettable, and a slam-dunk certainty for some kind of oscar, whether screenplay, acting, or directorial.\n\nWow.
